intro: Senecio dubitabilis, commonly known as the Dubitable Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
